dynamicalSystems
Class Condition

java.lang.Object
  dynamicalSystems.Entity
      dynamicalSystems.Condition

public class Condition
extends Entity

This class represents the condition to a given IfThenElse object. A Condition may be created using elements,relationships, or even another condition

Author:
Wellington Bruno

Field Detail

op

protected char op
'op' is the operator that indicates which is the comparison to be done

e1

protected Entity e1
e1 is the first Entity to be compared. May be either an element,or a relationship, or another Condition

e2

protected Entity e2
e2 is the second Entity to be compared. May be either an element,or a relationship, or another Condition

negate

protected boolean negate
Sometimes, you may want negate some condition. This attribute represents the Not Function. If you want to negate some condition, you shall turn this true,calling the method negateCondition()

isValid

protected boolean isValid()
This method evaluates if the condition is valid. It means that the method evaluates if the condition is true or false.

Returns:
True if the condition is true, or false, if the condition is false

negateCondition

public void negateCondition()
When this method is called for a given condition, the condition is negated.
